channel.title: close quarters on courtside nyc
channel.description: Recent content in close quarters on courtside nyc

item.title: old john's luncheonette
item.description: thoughts pies looked bomb typical diner

item.title: this bowl
item.description: thoughts line moves quick

item.title: s&p lunch
item.description: thoughts worth wait in line 1-2 people perfect #, might wait longer for 3-4 menu highlights tuna melt pastrami

item.title: b&h dairy
item.description: thoughts different deal every day of the week menu highlights tuna melt

item.title: jazba
item.description: thoughts liberal with the butter and i’m not mad menu highlights basket chaat

item.title: hudson clearwater
item.description: thoughts private dining room downstairs, great for birthday dinner

item.title: gazab
item.description: thoughts criminally underrated usually have resys available at the last minute menu highlights tandoori pineapple bokchoy chaat

item.title: emmett's on grove
item.description: thoughts super thin crust pizza is delicious and 6 “slices” feels like 1 normal slice of pizza, so your group can order multiple pizzas and not live in fear of leftovers or over-ordering i saw two birthday dinners during my 2 hour dining experience and they bring out sparklers! they have a couple big tables, but the best is the giant circular booth in the back left corner. you can fit 10 friends and get to talk to everyone! menu highlights key lime pie was so good it brought tears to my eyes.

item.title: buvette
item.description: thoughts where day drinking espresso martinis is acceptable

item.title: malaparte
item.description: menu highlights tiramisu excellent

item.title: kiki's
item.description: thoughts walk-in only. the restaurant is low-key huge so i’ve never had to wait a long time. also there’s so many cool bars close by for you to go grab a drink while you wait. menu highlights maroulosalata salad zucchini chips grilled octopus mixed grill

item.title: le dive
item.description: thoughts the best place to sit outside on a nice day. tables spill into dimes square - outdoor seating + cobblestones feels very european. basement bar where you can dance late nite !

item.title: 12 chairs cafe
item.description: thoughts the tables are extremely tight. you will be on top of each other, but vibes couldn’t be fresher. it’s always packed. brunch is lit - especially if the sun is out, the hoes will be hoeing and the brunch will be brunching. menu highlights low-key the schnitzel slaps arayes

item.title: san marzano
item.description: thoughts amazing pre fixe deal ($49 pp) bottomless beer, wine, sangria skews young bc it’s so cheap wine is most likely franzia pasta is delicious

item.title: spicy moon
item.description: thoughts so good you won’t even know it’s vegan. there’s two locations. one in the east village and one in the west village, but the ev location is my favorite. menu highlights bathe me in the spicy wontons in chili oil.

item.title: lil frankie's
item.description: thoughts crowd skews younger outdoor/curbside seating

item.title: fiaschetteria pistoia
item.description: thoughts wine changes all the time, they bring your choices out in a carrier, very fun post dinner espresso hits

item.title: panna ii
item.description: thoughts where were you when the world shut down? i was at panna ii bella hadid had her birthday here there are multiple pannas, so make sure you go to the right one - it’s top right very fun, stimulating experience - would not recommend for those sensitive to lights you’re gonna feel like sardines in there

item.title: cafe cluny
item.description: thoughts odds of d list celebrity sighting are high. bring your friend who’s cosplaying as an influencer while you enjoy a delicious burger. two birds one stone. menu highlights fries are excellent.

item.title: wondee siam
item.description: thoughts go-to spot when i lived in hell’s kitchen menu highlights crispy pork

item.title: jacob's pickles
item.description: thoughts looks expensive, but one sandwich lasted me 3 meals
